div.head: To the Right Worshipfull, Sir THOMAS SMITH, of London Knight, one of his Maiesties Councell for VIRGINIA, and Treasurer for the Colonie, and Gouernour of the Companies of the MOSCOVIA and East INDIA Merchants Peace, health and happinesse in CHRIST.
div.p:
FOrasmuch as I haue alwayes obserued your honest zeale to God, accompanied with so excellent carriage and resolution, in actions of best consequence,
I cannot but discouer vnto you for your further encouragement, the summe of a priuate speech or discourse, touching our plantation in Virginia, vttered not long since in London, where some few Aduenturers (well affecting the enterprise) being met together touching their intended proiect, one among the rest stood vp and began to relate (in effect) as followeth.
